page.title: 04ECOLOGY-THE LOE POOL AREA
page.content: The walks in the woodlands around Loe pool are great for anybody who is interested in Natural History.Most of the trees are hardwoods such as Ash,Horse Chestnut,Oak,Beech,Elm with an increasing amount of Sycamore.The softwoods of the area are mostly Scots Pine and Larch which are not naturallly found here but have been set out in plantations. There are an enormous amount of wild flowers in this area.This is a list of the main varieties that can be found. This list was compiled in early May. Spotted Medic,Celandine,Pink and Red Campion,Bluebell,Wood Speedwell, Forget-Me-Not,Sea Holly,Sorrel,Scarlet Pimpernel,Wild Garlic,Violet,Stitch wort,Ground Ivy,Yellow Pimpernel, Honeysuckle,Yellow Gorse,Rock Campion, Alescanders,Spring Squill,Herb Robert.
